info.title: Kimai - API
info.description: JSON API for the Kimai time-tracking software. Find more infos in our [API documentation](https://www.kimai.org/documentation/rest-api.html).

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The field by which results will be ordered. Allowed values: id, user, type, code (default: id)

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The result order. Allowed values: ASC, DESC (default: DESC)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page to display, renders a 404 if not found (default: 1)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The amount of entries for each page (default: 50)

200.description: Returns a collection of UserAuthCodes

get.description: If not yet existing, this call will create the code for the configured default type.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: User ID to fetch

200.description: Returns one UserAuthCodes entity

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User ID to filter absences. Needs permission 'contract_other_profile' (default: current user)

parameters.name: begin
parameters.description: Only absences after this date will be included (format: HTML5)

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Only absences before this date will be included (format: HTML5)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status to fetch. Allowed are: 'approved', 'open', 'all' (default: 'approved')

200.description: Returns a collection of absence entities

post.description: If a mandatory approval workflow is attached to the "absence type", the approval will be created in the "open" state.

200.description: Returns a collection of absence entities

delete.description: This unlocks all months from the specified month to the end of the given year.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The User ID whose lock will be removed

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: All months including the given one will be unlocked (format: Y-m-d)

get.description: The result is paginated and by default limited to 50 entries.

parameters.description: User IDs

parameters.name: begin
parameters.description: Only records after this date will be included (format: HTML5)

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Only records before this date will be included (format: HTML5)

parameters.name: refundable
parameters.description: Use this flag if you want to filter for refundable expenses. Allowed values: 0=not refundable, 1=refundable (default: all)

parameters.name: exported
parameters.description: Use this flag if you want to filter for export state. Allowed values: 0=not exported, 1=exported (default: all)

parameters.name: term
parameters.description: Free search term

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The field by which results will be ordered. Allowed values: begin, end, duration, total, category, cost, user, customer, project, activity, description, exported, refundable, multiplier (default: begin)

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The result order. Allowed values: ASC, DESC (default: DESC)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page to display, renders a 404 if not found (default: 1)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The amount of entries for each page (default: 50)

parameters.description: The type of object to fetch meta-fields for. Allowed values: timesheet, customer, project, activity, user, expense, invoice - returns all if not given (default: all)

parameters.name: customer
parameters.description: Customer ID to filter projects

parameters.name: customers[]
parameters.description: List of customer IDs to filter, e.g.: customers[]=1&customers[]=2

parameters.name: visible
parameters.description: Visibility status to filter projects: 1=visible, 2=hidden, 3=both

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Only projects that started before this date will be included. Allowed format: HTML5 (default: now, if end is also empty)

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Only projects that ended after this date will be included. Allowed format: HTML5 (default: now, if start is also empty)

parameters.name: ignoreDates
parameters.description: If set, start and end are completely ignored. Allowed values: 1 (default: off)

parameters.name: globalActivities
parameters.description: If given, filters projects by their 'global activity' support. Allowed values: 1 (supports global activities) and 0 (without global activities) (default: all)

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The result order. Allowed values: ASC, DESC (default: ASC)

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The field by which results will be ordered. Allowed values: id, name, customer (default: name)

parameters.description: Free search term

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The field by which results will be ordered. Allowed values: id, begin, end, rate (default: begin)

parameters.name: order

parameters.name: begin
parameters.description: Only records after this date will be included (format: HTML5 datetime-local, e.g. YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss)

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Only records before this date will be included (format: HTML5 datetime-local, e.g. YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss)

parameters.name: exported
parameters.description: Use this flag if you want to filter for export state. Allowed values: 0=not exported, 1=exported (default: all)

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Filter for running/active records. Allowed values: 0=stopped, 1=active (default: all)

parameters.name: billable
parameters.description: Filter for non-/billable records. Allowed values: 0=non-billable, 1=billable (default: all)

parameters.name: full
parameters.description: Allows to fetch full objects including subresources. Allowed values: 0|1|false|true (default: false)

parameters.name: term
parameters.description: Free search term

parameters.name: modified_after
parameters.description: Only records changed after this date will be included (format: HTML5 datetime-local, e.g. YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss)

200.description: Returns a collection of timesheets. The datetime fields are given in the users local time including the timezone offset (ISO-8601).

parameters.name: id

get.description:
This route is available via GET and PATCH, as users over and over again run into errors when stopping.
Likely caused by a slow JS engine and a fast-click after page reload.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Timesheet ID to stop

200.description: Stops an active timesheet and returns it afterwards.

patch.description:
This route is available via GET and PATCH, as users over and over again run into errors when stopping.
Likely caused by a slow JS engine and a fast-click after page reload.

get.description: The restarted timesheet will be created for the current user

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Timesheet ID to restart

200.description: Restart a timesheet for the same customer, project, activity combination. The current user will be the owner of the new record. Kimai tries to stop running records, which is expected to fail depending on the configured rules. Data will be copied from the original record if requested.

patch.description: The restarted timesheet will be created for the current user

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Timesheet ID to duplicate

200.description: Duplicates a timesheet, resetting the export state only.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Timesheet ID to switch export state

200.description: Switches the exported state on the record and therefor locks / unlocks it for further updates. Needs edit_export_*_timesheet permission.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: User ID to set the custom-field value for

200.description: Sets the value of a consifgured preference. You cannot create unknown preferences: if the given name is not configured, an exception will be raised.

todo.description: The actual doings, which will be available on the detail and edit page.

end.title: Attention: Accessor MUST be used, otherwise date will be serialized in UTC.

estimation.title: Estimated duration for the task in seconds or null if no estimation was added

metaFields.title: Meta fields registered with the task

entityType.title: The rule is meant for this entity type (e.g. user, customer)

name.title: The internal meta-field name, which is used for access (e.g. in invoice-templates)

label.title: The label used to describe the form (input) field

help.title: A longer and optional help text used to further describe the form field

value.title: The default value for the meta-field

type.title: The form field type for this rule

visible.title: Whether the field is visible in listing views

required.title: Whether the field is mandatory (true) or optional (false)

cost.description: Cost per entry (multiplied by multiplier). This field is not available to every user.

billableMode.description: Whether this item should be refundable (yes) or not (no) or if it should be calculated by inherited settings from customer, project and activity (auto).

metaFields.title: Meta fields registered with the expense

color.title: The assigned color in HTML hex format, e.g. #dd1d00

comment.description: Comment for the absence. Will be visible in the in the absence list.

end.description: End date of this absence. This field is not supported by all absence types.

color.description: The hexadecimal color code (default: auto-calculated by name)

address.title: Unstructured address, better use the fields: address_line1-3, postcode, city, country

metaFields.title: Meta fields registered with the customer

teams.title: Teams with access to the customer

budget.title: The total monetary budget, will be zero if not configured.

timeBudget.title: The time budget in seconds, will be zero if not configured.

budgetType.title:
The type of budget:
 - null      = default / full time
 - month     = monthly budget
